result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Isaiah M. Jafferi

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Filed by Atty Satorius, appointing Atty Schmidt. sm
for victims parents to appear via zoom. filed by ADA Ellenwood

Includes 22CM535 & 22CM536

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, T. Groskreutz, K. Groskreutz and Z. Leech or their residence.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 10, 2022 at 09:30 am.
PTC set for 11-3-2022 reset due to conflict w/ Court's calendar. RJG
Pre-trial/scheduling conference on November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:07 PM Apprs: CO: S. Needham, Rpr: V. Kasten, Clerk: B Harris,  Defendant Isaiah M. Jafferi in court, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie Kay Schmidt in court for Isaiah M. Jafferi.  Prosecuting attorney Michael Joseph Becker in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 22CM535, 22CM536 & 22FO475. DE does qualify for PD and confirms address. As to 22CM535- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.   As to 22CM536- Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG.  Court enters NG to FO case.  DE is on PO hold. Bond argument.  Court orders bond. DE to update clerk with address while going over bond. Adjourned at 1:29 PM. bph
Pre-trial/scheduling conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
